author: Vlciudoli
title: The WORST staff I've ever encountered.
text:
This hotel is beautiful. Absolutely stunning decor and a really lovely feel to it.
I was upgraded to a suite due to aBooking.com error, so you can imagine I was pleased.
The hotel room safe didn't work, and they were unable to fix it, which was a little disappointing.
What was COMPLETELY unacceptable was the bat service.
I entered the bar at around 8pm. There were possible 4 people in there, all seated and with drinks.
The bar was unattended so I waited for around 3 minutes. Not ideal, but I wasn't on a schedule!
When the female bartender finally arrived, I asked for a simple Gin and Tonic.
Her response was unbelievable.
'I cannot make this as I have to cook dinner for another customer.'
I assumed I had mishear, so I asked for clarification. She repeated it!
I explained that she could have served the drink in the time it took to say she couldn't. She still refused.
It is worth mentioning that I was the only person seeking service. She could have served me and gone to the kitchen (although why a hotel with these tariffs has a bartender also acting as a cool is beyond me).
I left and complained at reception. The bartender followed me and tried to stop me by offering to make the drink! Madness.
I left the hotel in disgust, only to be called back by the receptionist trying to make me accept a drink.
This is an awful level of customer care.
On checkout the next day, no enquiry was made as to my stay and no apology for the debacle.
This was such a a disappointment. I was in business, and was so impressed by the appearance of the place that I'd wanted to return socially, but clearly that won't be happening.
AVOID. Or use the minibar.
